text: I have a task to download Gbs of data from a website.
The data is in form of .gz files, each file being 45mb in size.
The easy way to get the files is use "wget -r -np -A files url".
This will donwload data in a recursive format and mirrors the website.
The donwload rate is very high 4mb/sec.
But, just to play around I was also using python to build my urlparser.
Downloading via Python's urlretrieve is damm slow, possible 4 times as slow as wget.
I use HTMLParser for parsing the href tags.
I am not sure why is this happening.
Are there any settings for this.
